values:
I have such papal cred.  My favorite for title of De Gloria Olivae was Carlo Cardinal Martini.  I was campaigning for Martini who is an intellectual (linguist, jousted with Umberto Eco, respected New Testament scholar) and a liberal (though not Kung level) firebrand. Unfortunately, Martini has as much chance as Cardinal Law being elected (even that seems more likely) because he's also an eeeeeeeevill jebbesuit. Long story short, the Vatican has never liked the Society of Jesus and it won't start liking them now. He's also retired his from post as Archbishop of Milan and is a bajillion years old. However, on PaddyPower, Martini has gone from being a 20-1 shot to being tied for first place with Cardinal Lustiger 4-1.  Ratzinger has dropped to third, with Hummes and Arinze following. The only thing I can think of is that I have special King-making skillz when it comes to papabile.  For the record I was wrong about the last election too, but let's hope that they won't make the Grand Inquistor infallible.
                                      
                                      First among equals               
 
                                    
               Rome Has Spoken, and it said "Bite me Kung"
Hugs and Kisses back at ya Keith!  And to think that the spooge covered chalk dustings were to be my last entry.

Apologies ahead for the incessant and frankly nauseating navel gazing ahead, but damn it, I need some outlet.

You are on the middle of Speedway.  With a tree branch you reach out and hit five or six more students with more intelligence, ambition, and and/or talent than me.  The world doesn't fucking want another mediocre writer with conventional bland tastes shaped by forces already making better dreamers, writers, artists.  The issues I care about are already being covered thoroughly and by people much better than me (morally and intellectually).  To be bluntly honest, I'm finding it hard why people should even bother with another shrug of a personality like myself.  Angry young woman trapped by bourgeoisie values of the American middle class?  Read Prep, Elizabeth Wurtzel, or just look under Bitches on the Barnes and Noble shelves.  I have nothing to offer to the world that hasn't already been done to death, and I am sorry for everyone who gave their best to me thinking that I could have.

From his last article for Rolling Stone Fear and Loathing, Campaign 2004:

Things haven't changed all that much where George W. Bush comes from. Houston is a cruel and crazy town on a filthy river in East Texas with no zoning laws and a culture of sex, money and violence. It's a shabby sprawling metropolis ruled by brazen women, crooked cops and super-rich pansexual cowboys who live by the code of the West -- which can mean just about anything you need it to mean, in a pinch.

Thompson distills all the evil, ugliness, and cholesterol soaked obesity of Houston into three sentences.  Welcome to the home of Tom DeLay (via Sugar Land AKA the #2 destination for white flight from Southwest Houston), Halliburton, and Enron.  Sometimes I wonder if this will be last we will see of any major pop culture iconoclasts like Thompson and BBC One icon John Peel, and if our generation (according to BoBo Brooks) "The Organization Kids" have enough character to fill their shoes.  Those Krazy Kaplan Kids simply don't have enough weird, courage, or fucking heart to care.
Because this thing needed to be desecrated.  Goddamn live journals are like STDs; one mercy fuck and you get one.  Grr....
